questions.text: Which of the following is deficient in a patient with features as shown below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Tryptophan

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Pellagra can occur due to:
  • ➤ Pellagra can occur due to:
  • ➤ ﻿﻿ Vitamin B3 (Niacin) deficiency ﻿﻿Tryptophan deficiency: Niacin is synthetised from tryptophan Deficient synthesis: Kynureninase, an important enzyme in the pathway of tryptophan, is pyridoxal phosphate dependent. So, conversion of tryptophan to niacin is not possible in pyridoxal deficiency. Isoniazid (INH): It is an anti-tubercular drug, which inhibits pyridoxal phosphate formation. Hence, there is block in conversion of tryptophan to NAD. Hartnup disease: Tryptophan absorption from intestine is defective in this congenital disease. Moreover, tryptophan is excreted in urine in large quantities. This leads to lack of tryptophan and consequently deficiency of nicotinamide. Carcinoid syndrome: The tumor utilizes major portion of available tryptophan for synthesis of serotonin; so, tryptophan is unavailable.
  • ➤ ﻿﻿ Vitamin B3 (Niacin) deficiency
  • ➤ Vitamin B3 (Niacin) deficiency
  • ➤ ﻿﻿Tryptophan deficiency: Niacin is synthetised from tryptophan
  • ➤ ﻿﻿Tryptophan deficiency:
  • ➤ Deficient synthesis: Kynureninase, an important enzyme in the pathway of tryptophan, is pyridoxal phosphate dependent. So, conversion of tryptophan to niacin is not possible in pyridoxal deficiency.
  • ➤ Deficient synthesis:
  • ➤ Isoniazid (INH): It is an anti-tubercular drug, which inhibits pyridoxal phosphate formation. Hence, there is block in conversion of tryptophan to NAD.
  • ➤ Isoniazid (INH):
  • ➤ Hartnup disease: Tryptophan absorption from intestine is defective in this congenital disease. Moreover, tryptophan is excreted in urine in large quantities. This leads to lack of tryptophan and consequently deficiency of nicotinamide.
  • ➤ Hartnup disease:
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome: The tumor utilizes major portion of available tryptophan for synthesis of serotonin; so, tryptophan is unavailable.
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome:

questions.text: In ethylene glycol poisoning, which of these is increased in the blood? (Twisted PYQ)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Oxalic and glycolic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In ethylene glycol poisoning, glycolic acid and oxalic acid levels increase due to the metabolic breakdown of ethylene glycol, with calcium oxalate crystal formation being a characteristic finding.

Ans. C) Sexual gratification by rubbing his private parts against another person

questions.text: A G2P1 woman with previous child having Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy comes for USG examination at 16 weeks. What is the appropriate course of action? (Twisted PYQ)

options.label: A
options.text: Do USG and refer for genetic testing without sex determination

options.label: B
options.text: Do USG with sex determination as DMD is X-linked

options.label: C
options.text: Refer directly for amniocentesis without USG

options.label: D
options.text: Do USG and counsel for medical termination

questions.correct_answer: A. Do USG and refer for genetic testing without sex determination
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • This approach is correct because:
  • • USG can assess fetal anatomy and growth Genetic testing can diagnose DMD directly Sex determination remains prohibited by law Maintains compliance with PCPNDT Act Provides appropriate medical care

  • • Genetic testing can diagnose DMD directly
  • • Sex determination remains prohibited by law
  • • Maintains compliance with PCPNDT Act
  • • Provides appropriate medical care
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Do USG with sex determination
  • • Option B. Do USG with sex determination
  • • Violates PCPNDT Act Sex determination illegal even for genetic conditions Not necessary as direct genetic testing available Could result in legal consequences
  • • Violates PCPNDT Act
  • • Sex determination illegal even for genetic conditions
  • • Not necessary as direct genetic testing available
  • • Could result in legal consequences
  • • Option C. Direct amniocentesis without USG
  • • Option C. Direct amniocentesis without USG
  • • USG guidance needed for safe amniocentesis Baseline anatomy scan important Skips important preliminary assessment Not standard of care
  • • USG guidance needed for safe amniocentesis
  • • Baseline anatomy scan important
  • • Skips important preliminary assessment
  • • Not standard of care
  • • Option D. USG and counsel for termination
  • • Option D. USG and counsel for termination
  • • Premature without genetic diagnosis Ethically inappropriate Legally questionable Does not follow proper diagnostic protocol
  • • Premature without genetic diagnosis
  • • Ethically inappropriate
  • • Legally questionable
  • • Does not follow proper diagnostic protocol

questions.text: A 30-year-old alcoholic comes to the casualty after being hurt in a fight with a stranger. A lacerated wound is seen over his skull. Which of the following is the correct mechanism of this lacerated wound? ( INICET Nov 2021)

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Overstretching of skin and subcutaneous tissue

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Tissue crushed between weapon and underlying bone
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Tissue crushed between weapon and underlying bone

questions.text: Identify the method of killing shown in the picture below : ( INICET Nov 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Burking

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Burking involves a combination of smothering and traumatic asphyxia, characterized by chest compression and obstruction of the airways, a method historically associated with the criminal activities of Burke and Hare.

questions.text: In seat belt injury, the most commonly involved organ is: (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Hollow viscus

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Seat belts are known to decrease mortality and prevent head injuries in accidents. However, they can increase the risk of certain abdominal and thoracic injuries.
  • • Among all the thoracic and abdominal injuries associated with seat belt use, the maximum damage occurs to three organs: mesentery, omentum, and bowel (hollow viscus). This combination of injuries is known as the "seat belt syndrome." Therefore, the most commonly involved organ in seat belt injury is the hollow viscus.
  • • three organs: mesentery, omentum, and bowel (hollow viscus).
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option. A. Liver + Spleen: Although liver and spleen injuries can occur in seat belt injuries, they are not the most commonly involved organs compared to the hollow viscus.
  • • Option. A. Liver + Spleen:
  • • Option. B. Lungs: While thoracic injuries can be increased due to seat belt use, the lungs are not the most commonly involved organ in seat belt injuries.
  • • Option. B. Lungs:
  • • Option. C. Head of Pancreas: The head of the pancreas is not the most commonly involved organ in seat belt injuries compared to the hollow viscus.
  • • Option. C. Head of Pancreas:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In seat belt injuries, the most commonly involved organ is the hollow viscus (bowel), along with the mesentery and omentum, constituting the "seat belt syndrome." Although seat belts are protective and prevent head injuries, they can increase the risk of certain abdominal and thoracic injuries, with the hollow viscus being the most frequently affected.

questions.text: Match the following (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A-2, B-1, C-3, D-4, E-5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Eonism (Transvestism) is wearing clothes of the opposite sex, Frotteurism is rubbing genitals against another person, Necrophilia is having sex with dead bodies, Exhibitionism is exposing genitalia to unsuspecting individuals, and Passive Algoglenia is gratification from experiencing pain.

questions.text: Fracture of the hyoid bone and thyroid cartilage with neck muscle bruising suggests a diagnosis of? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Strangulation

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • In cases of strangulation, certain forensic signs are typically evident, including bruising of neck muscles and fractures of the hyoid bone and thyroid cartilage. These injuries result from the direct force applied to the neck, differentiating strangulation from other causes of neck injury like hanging, where such signs are less common due to the nature of the force applied (more often vertical). The presence of these specific injuries provides clear forensic evidence suggesting a homicide rather than a suicide or accident.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Hanging: Incorrect. Hanging typically results in an oblique ligature mark high on the neck, and fractures are less common as the force is primarily vertical.
  • • Option B. Hanging:
  • • Option C. Choking: Incorrect. Choking involves blockage of the airway internally by an object, without external trauma to the neck structures.
  • • Option C. Choking:
  • • Option D. Gagging: Incorrect. Gagging does not typically result in physical trauma to the neck's structural components like the hyoid bone or thyroid cartilage.
  • • Option D. Gagging:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bruising of neck muscles and fractures of the hyoid bone and thyroid cartilage are characteristic forensic indicators of strangulation.

questions.text: A farmer was working in his field at night when he felt a sharp pain in his foot. Within 30 minutes, he developed ptosis, difficulty speaking, and progressive descending paralysis without significant local swelling or bleeding. Which of the following is the most likely cause? questions.explanation:

  • • Nocturnal bite (typical of krait)
  • • Ptosis as early manifestation
  • • Absence of significant bleeding/swelling
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Viper
  • • Option A. Viper
  • • Causes severe local pain and swelling Prominent bleeding manifestations Blistering and tissue damage No significant neurological symptoms early on
  • • Causes severe local pain and swelling
  • • Prominent bleeding manifestations
  • • Blistering and tissue damage
  • • No significant neurological symptoms early on
  • • Option C. Scorpion
  • • Option C. Scorpion
  • • Causes severe local pain Autonomic symptoms predominate No true paralysis Positive tap test Profuse sweating and salivation
  • • Causes severe local pain
  • • Autonomic symptoms predominate
  • • No true paralysis
  • • Positive tap test
  • • Profuse sweating and salivation
  • • Option D. Wasp
  • • Option D. Wasp
  • • Immediate intense local pain Allergic reactions possible No paralysis Multiple stings usually required for systemic effects
  • • Immediate intense local pain
  • • Allergic reactions possible
  • • No paralysis
  • • Multiple stings usually required for systemic effects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ To understand:
  • ➤ Different envenomation patterns Importance of timing and circumstances Distinguishing neurotoxic from vasculotoxic effects Value of minimal local symptoms in diagnosis Role of bite circumstances in identification
  • ➤ Different envenomation patterns
  • ➤ Importance of timing and circumstances
  • ➤ Distinguishing neurotoxic from vasculotoxic effects
  • ➤ Value of minimal local symptoms in diagnosis
  • ➤ Role of bite circumstances in identification

questions.text: A 20-year-old sexual assault victim was examined in court "in camera." What does it imply? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Closed proceeding

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ "In camera" refers to a closed proceeding in court where only selected individuals are allowed to be present, ensuring the privacy of sensitive cases such as those involving sexual assault.

questions.text: An autopsy was performed to find the cause of death of a person brought dead to the casualty. It showed abrasions on the neck, fracture of the thyroid cartilage and contused tissues in the neck. The cause of death is? ( AIIMS May 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Throttling

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Throttling involves manual strangulation by applying pressure to the neck, causing abrasions, contusions, and fractures in the neck structures.

questions.text: What type of mutation is seen in sickle cell anemia? ( AIIMS Nov 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Point mutations

  • ➤ Educational Objective

questions.text: What is the cause of the lesion shown in the image below?(INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Lightning strike

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Filigree burns or Lichtenberg flowers are pathognomonic for lightning strikes and appear as superficial, fern-like patterns on the skin that fade within 24-48 hours.

questions.text: Acrodynia is primarily associated with poisoning by which substance? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mercury

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Acrodynia, also known as Pink's disease, is a condition seen in infants and young children that results from chronic mercury poisoning. It is characterized by a pinkish rash starting at the extremities, painful swelling of hands and feet, and desquamation of the skin. This condition reflects a hypersensitivity reaction to mercury and is managed by removing the child from exposure to mercury and initiating chelation therapy to remove the heavy metal from the body.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B: Incorrect as phenolic acid is not associated with the symptoms of acrodynia.
  • • Option B:
  • • Option C: Incorrect because oxalic acid poisoning does not lead to acrodynia, but can cause kidney stones and other metabolic disturbances.
  • • Option C:
  • • Option D : Incorrect as carbolic acid poisoning primarily causes local burns and systemic toxicity different from the symptoms seen in acrodynia.
  • • Option D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acrodynia is a symptom complex specifically associated with chronic mercury poisoning in children, characterized by a distinctive pink rash and painful swelling.

questions.text: An unknown substance consumption leads to tachycardia and red coloured halo. This is seen with consumption of: (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) LSD

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The consumption of an unknown substance leading to tachycardia and ared-coloured halo can be associated with both cocaine and LSD. However, based on the limited information provided in the question, LSD is the more likely answer.
  • • Both cocaine and LSD can cause sympathomimetic features such as tachycardia, sweating, increased heart rate, and increased blood pressure. However, these symptoms are generally more pronounced with cocaine consumption. On the other hand, hallucinogenic features, such as hallucinations, are more commonly associated with LSD use.
  • • Other options:
  • • Other options:
  • • Option. A. Cannabis : Cannabis has minimal physiological effects and is unlikely to cause tachycardia and sweating.
  • • Option. A. Cannabis
  • • Option. B. Crack/Cocaine: If the question had emphasized intense tachycardia, intense sweating, and other sympathomimetic symptoms, cocaine would have been the more appropriate answer. However, based on the given information, LSD is the better fit.
  • • Option. B. Crack/Cocaine:
  • • Option. D. Heroine: Heroin is a central nervous system (CNS) depressant and typically leads to bradycardia rather than tachycardia.
  • • Option. D. Heroine:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Both cocaine and LSD can cause sympathomimetic features like tachycardia and sweating, but these symptoms are more intense with cocaine. Hallucinations are more commonly associated with LSD. The correct answer depends on the specific details provided in the question, emphasizing either sympathomimetic or hallucinogenic features.

questions.text: Graph of cooling of the body? (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sigmoid shaped

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The graph of cooling of the body is best described as sigmoid shaped, indicating the initial slow cooling followed by a steady decrease and stabilization of temperature. ​​

questions.text: Identify the gestational age of the fetus if the Crown Rump Length is 21 cm, length of lower limb is 10 cm, gestational age of the fetus will be: (AIIMS May 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. 6 to 7 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Rule of Haase can be used to estimate gestational age from fetal measurements. For a crown-heel length greater than 25 cm, the gestational age is calculated by dividing the crown-heel length by 5.

questions.text: Identify the person to whom the First-hand knowledge rule is applicable? ( AIIMS May 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Common witness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first-hand knowledge rule ensures that the testimony provided by a common witness is based on direct observation and personal experience, thereby maintaining the integrity and reliability of the evidence presented in court.

questions.text: Which metal causes the endemic peripheral vascular disease known as Blackfoot disease?(INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Arsenic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blackfoot disease, characterized by darkening and gangrene of the feet and lower legs, is specifically caused by chronic arsenic poisoning. Other heavy metals such as cadmium, lead, and mercury can cause peripheral vascular disease, but Blackfoot disease is unique to arsenic exposure.

questions.text: A child was born after 8 months of the father’s death. Grandparents filed a case that the baby might not be their son’s, but DNA came positive. What is such a child called? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Posthumous child

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A posthumous child is one born after the death of a parent, as seen in this scenario where the child was born 8 months after the father's death.

questions.text: A young child complained to his parents that he was touched inappropriately by a neighbor. On examination by a doctor in the OPD, he complained of pain when touched in the perianal area. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, it produces yellow rhombic crystals of spermine pirate. What is the test done? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Barberio test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ The Barberio test detects the presence of spermine from semen by forming yellow needle-shaped crystals of spermine picrate, making it the correct test for the described scenario.

questions.text: Identical twins have similarities in all of the following except: ( NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fingerprint pattern

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ While identical twins share the same blood group, DNA fingerprinting, and iris color due to their identical genetic makeup, their fingerprint patterns are unique to each individual due to non-inheritable factors.

questions.text: A dead body is brought for postmortem examination with stellate shaped gunshot wound and muzzle imprint. What can be the distance? (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Contact shot

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of a stellate shaped wound with a muzzle imprint indicates a contact shot. This is a crucial finding in forensic examinations to determine the distance of the firearm at the time of discharge.
  • ➤ Key points to understand about gunshot wounds and range of fire:
  • ➤ Key points to understand about gunshot wounds and range of fire:

questions.text: A rape victim is brought to the casualty of a government hospital for examination. Within what time should a vaginal swab be taken to look for the presence of spermatozoa? ( AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Within 72 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Presence of spermatozoa and other microorganisms
  • ➤ Presence of spermatozoa and other microorganisms
  • ➤ •Spermatozoa remain motile in the vagina for 6-8 hours, occasionally up to 12 hours.
  • ➤ •Nonmotile forms can be detected for about 24 hours, rarely up to 48-72 hours.
  • ➤ •Detection involves aspirating vaginal contents and examining under a microscope.
  • ➤ •Motile sperms suggest recent intercourse; nonmotile sperms indicate a broader time frame (12-72 hours).
  • ➤ •Intact spermatozoa are rarely found in the vagina after 72 hours.
  • ➤ •Seminal fluid detection from vasectomized males requires prostatic acid phosphatase demonstration.
  • ➤ •P30, a semen-specific glycoprotein, is used as a screening test, detectable in vaginal fluid for about 27 hours.

questions.text: A 50-year-old lady underwent a total abdominal hysterectomy. She came to the hospital after one week with acute pain in the abdomen with features suggestive of perforation. An X-ray showed the following picture. Identify the type of offense for which the surgeon can be held responsible? ( INICET Nov 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Res ipsa loquitur

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of surgical instruments left inside a patient post-operation is a clear case of negligence, aptly described by the legal principle of "Res ipsa loquitur," meaning the fact speaks for itself.

questions.text: A soft friable extradural hematoma with a honeycomb appearance on autopsy is seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Heat hematoma

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • A heat hematoma, also known as an epidural hematoma due to intense heat or burns, occurs when the head is exposed to extreme heat, enough to charring the skull. This type of hematoma presents with a distinctive honeycomb appearance due to steam bubbles produced by the heat. The clot is soft and friable, and its color can vary from "light chocolate" to pink if the blood contains carbon monoxide. This appearance is unique to heat hematomas and helps differentiate them from other types of hematomas.
  • • Other Options
  • • Other Options
  • • Option A. Coagulopathy: While coagulopathy can lead to various types of bleeding disorders, it does not typically produce the characteristic honeycomb appearance seen in heat hematomas.
  • • Option A. Coagulopathy:
  • • Option C. Postmortem; blunt force: Postmortem changes due to blunt force trauma do not result in a soft friable clot with a honeycomb appearance.
  • • Option C. Postmortem; blunt force:
  • • Option D. Antemortem; blunt force: Antemortem blunt force trauma can cause epidural hematomas, but these typically have a rubbery consistency and are localized, without the honeycomb appearance.
  • • Option D. Antemortem; blunt force:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A soft friable extradural hematoma with a honeycomb appearance is indicative of a heat hematoma, resulting from intense heat exposure sufficient to charring the skull.

questions.text: Identify the image shown below. ( INICET Nov 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Gunshot wound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A gunshot wound can be identified by its central round hole, surrounding soot, singeing of hairs, tattooing from powder particles, and bevelling of the wound edges.

questions.text: In a case of death during hospital admission, who can order an autopsy? (Twisted PYQ)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hospital Administrator

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In hospital deaths requiring clinical/academic autopsy, the hospital administrator has the authority to order the procedure with family consent, distinguishing it from medico-legal cases where police authorization is required.

options.label: A
options.text: Sexual assault done by police officer

questions.explanation: Ans. A. Sexual assault done by police officer

questions.text: Cherry red color staining is due to: (FMGE JANUARY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Carbon monoxide

  • ➤ Ref: Simpson’s Forensic Medicine, 13th edition, page 45

questions.text: A postmortem examination of a dead body reveals contracted muscles but no primary relaxation. This can be called as? (FMGE JANUARY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cadaveric spasm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cadaveric spasm involves the immediate and extreme contraction of muscles without primary relaxation, occurring right at the moment of death, and is often significant in determining the circumstances surrounding the death.
  • ➤ Ref: Text book of forensic medicine and toxicology, 5th edition, Krishan Vij, page 87
  • ➤ Ref: Text book of forensic medicine and toxicology, 5th edition, Krishan Vij, page 87

questions.text: A farmer presented with history of ingestion of an unknown substance. He had increased sweating, lacrimation, diarrhea, muscle weakness, and tachycardia. What is the drug of choice for treatment? ( INICET May 2022 )
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Atropine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of organophosphate poisoning presenting with symptoms like increased sweating, lacrimation, diarrhea, muscle weakness, and tachycardia, Atropine is the primary drug of choice for treatment. It acts by competitively inhibiting the muscarinic effects of acetylcholine.
  • ➤ Atropine

questions.text: Piquerism is related to? NEET PG 2017
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Paraphilia

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Piquerism is a type of paraphilia, which is a psychosexual disorder characterized by the pleasure derived from penetrating the skin of another person with sharp objects such as pins, needles, or razors. This act can sometimes be severe enough to cause significant harm or even death. The term piquerism originates from the French word "piquer," meaning "to prick."
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Hanging: Hanging is a method of suicide or execution involving suspension by the neck.
  • • Option A. Hanging:
  • • Option B. Firearm: Firearm injuries are related to gunshot wounds and are not connected to piquerism.
  • • Option B. Firearm:
  • • Option D. Drowning: Drowning is a form of asphyxia due to immersion in liquid, unrelated to piquerism.
  • • Option D. Drowning:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Piquerism is a paraphilia involving sexual arousal from penetrating another person's skin with sharp objects.

questions.text: Criminal responsibility of Insane is defined in: ( AIIMS Nov 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. McNaughten's Rule

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ McNaughten's rule is defined by section 84 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC)
  • ➤ It states that "A person of unsound mind is not liable for an act."
  • ➤ It implies that the defendant was unable to distinguish between right and wrong or otherwise didn't understand what they did because of a "disease of the mind."

questions.text: Declaration of Oslo is for? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Therapeutic abortion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Declaration of Oslo specifically addresses the ethical considerations involved in therapeutic abortion, distinguishing it from other declarations that focus on different ethical issues in medical practice

questions.text: A 45-year-old female patient is told about the benefits and complications of hysterectomy and she agrees to the procedure. What kind of consent is this? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Informed consent

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Consent can be classified in two ways:
  • ➤ Consent can be classified in two ways:
  • ➤ 1. Based on how the consent is given
  • ➤ 1. Based on how the consent is given
  • ➤ 2. Based on how much information provided:
  • ➤ 2. Based on how much information provided:

questions.text: A young male presents with suspected poisoning and has pin-point pupils. Which of the following can be the poison. (INICET NOVEMBER 2023)
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Opioid

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding the management of snakebite in India? (AIIMS MAY 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Atropine and neostigmine are very useful in the management of krait bite

options.label: B
options.text: Neostigmine and ventilatory support are used in treatment along with ASV

options.label: C
options.text: ASV is the mainstay of treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Current ASV in India is less effective against humped pit viper

questions.correct_answer: A. Atropine and neostigmine are very useful in the management of krait bite
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Atropine and neostigmine are very useful in the management of krait bite

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Treatment of snake bite:
  • ➤ Treatment of snake bite:
  • ➤ First Aid treatment have limited role. Reassure the patient, immobilize the limb and keep it below the heart level. Light pressure can be applied in neurotoxic snakes. Anti-snake venom (ASV) is the main treatment for snake bite. It contains antivenom against the 4 common poisonous snakes in India (Cobra, Krait, Russel’s viper and saw scaled viper). It does not contain antivenom against humped pit viper, which is found in some states of India, but still can be partially effective in it due to cross antibodies formation. Treatment in addition to ASV: Vasculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis and Blood Transfusion Musculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis Neurotoxic snakes: Ventilation and Neostigmine (along with atropine)
  • ➤ First Aid treatment have limited role. Reassure the patient, immobilize the limb and keep it below the heart level. Light pressure can be applied in neurotoxic snakes.
  • ➤ First Aid treatment have limited role.
  • ➤ Anti-snake venom (ASV) is the main treatment for snake bite. It contains antivenom against the 4 common poisonous snakes in India (Cobra, Krait, Russel’s viper and saw scaled viper). It does not contain antivenom against humped pit viper, which is found in some states of India, but still can be partially effective in it due to cross antibodies formation.
  • ➤ Anti-snake venom (ASV) is the main treatment for snake bite.
  • ➤ Treatment in addition to ASV: Vasculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis and Blood Transfusion Musculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis Neurotoxic snakes: Ventilation and Neostigmine (along with atropine)
  • ➤ Treatment in addition to ASV:
  • ➤ Vasculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis and Blood Transfusion Musculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis Neurotoxic snakes: Ventilation and Neostigmine (along with atropine)
  • ➤ Vasculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis and Blood Transfusion
  • ➤ Vasculotoxic symptoms:
  • ➤ Musculotoxic symptoms: Dialysis
  • ➤ Musculotoxic symptoms:
  • ➤ Neurotoxic snakes: Ventilation and Neostigmine (along with atropine)
  • ➤ Neurotoxic snakes:
  • ➤ Other Options: Explained above
  • ➤ Other Options: Explained above

questions.text: A case of accidental burn injuries in a female patient aged 35 years involving right upper limb, entire right lower limb, entire front and back of abdomen. Which of the following is the percentage of burn injuries according to the rule of nine? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 45%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The total body surface area (TBSA) involved is usually worked out by the Wallace Rule of Nines wherein each upper limb is 9% of TBSA, 9% each for the front and back of lower limb, 9% for the front and back of chest, 9% for the front and back of abdomen, the head and neck 9% and 1% for the perineum.

questions.text: Which section of IPC defines McNaughten's rule? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Section 84 of IPC

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Section 84 of IPC defines the act of a person of unsound mind and is derived from the McNaughten Rule, providing a legal defense for individuals who commit crimes due to their mental incapacity.

questions.text: A 51-year-old bomb blast victim is brought to the casualty with life-threatening injuries. There was a lot of chaos and no one was available to sign consent for emergency surgery. Despite surgery the patient died. The doctor is not responsible under which doctrine? (AIIMS MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Doctrine of anticipation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "Doctrine of anticipation," which permits medical interventions without prior consent in emergencies where delays could result in harm or death to the patient. This doctrine is crucial in understanding the legal protections afforded to doctors making critical decisions under duress and with the intent to save lives.

questions.text: Which of these is not a symptom of cocaine poisoning? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bradycardia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Cocaine poisoning typically causes increased heart rate (tachycardia) rather than bradycardia, along with other symptoms like myocardial ischemia, hyperthermia, and agitation.

questions.text: A 12-year-old girl, accompanied by her mother, is brought to a lady police sub-inspector, alleging a history of sexual violence that occurred two days ago. The next course of action for the registered medical practitioner would be?(INICET MAY 2023)

options.label: D
options.text: Documentation of injuries and examination findings

questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Take a detailed history

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In cases of alleged sexual violence, the initial and crucial step for the registered medical practitioner is to take a detailed history from the victim.

questions.text: A 56-year-old man presents with fatigue, pallor, and abdominal pain. He reports memory loss and reveals that he works at a battery recycling plant. On examination, a noticeable foot drop in both lower extremities is seen. Laboratory testing shows elevated blood lead levels. Which enzyme is affected in the given scenario? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Lead poisoning primarily inhibits the enzyme Aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase (ALAD), leading to disruptions in the heme synthesis pathway and accumulation of heme precursors.

questions.text: Eonism can be defined as? (INICET NOVEMBER 2022)
questions.correct_answer: A. Wearing clothes of opposite sex
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Eonism or transvestism is the act of wearing clothes of the opposite sex for pleasure, named after Charles Eon de Beaumont.

questions.text: A young woman was found dead at home under mysterious circumstances. Her live-in partner was reported missing. These were the postmortem images taken by the forensic photographer. Which of the following is the likely cause of her death? ( INICET Nov 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Throttling involves manual strangulation by applying pressure to the neck, causing bruises, abrasions, and contusions, and can lead to death by occlusion of blood supply or airway and pressure on the carotid sinus.

questions.text: A 42-year-old HIV-positive patient died, and his body was brought for post-mortem. The method of autopsy to be done is: ( NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Rokitansky technique

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Rokitansky technique involves dissecting organs in situ and is the preferred method for highly infectious diseases like HIV to prevent the spread of infection.

questions.text: Identify the plant which produces a toxin of abuse potential? ( AIIMS May 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Erythroxylum coca

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Cocaine is obtained from Erythroxylum coca, which can be identified by following features:
  • ➤ Leaves : Characteristic of the leaf is an areolated portion bounded by two longitudinal curved lines, one line on each side of the midrib. Flowers are small, and disposed in little clusters on short stalks. Red Berries: The flowers mature into red berries.
  • ➤ Leaves : Characteristic of the leaf is an areolated portion bounded by two longitudinal curved lines, one line on each side of the midrib.
  • ➤ Leaves
  • ➤ Flowers are small, and disposed in little clusters on short stalks.
  • ➤ Flowers
  • ➤ Red Berries: The flowers mature into red berries.
  • ➤ Red Berries:

questions.text: A 32-year-old female had a fight with her husband and was brought dead and an autopsy was performed to find the cause of death. Can you identify the probable cause of death from the image given below? ( AIIMS May 2017)
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Throttling

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient arrives at the hospital emergency department presenting with gastrointestinal distress. The patient complains of severe abdominal pain, frequent vomiting, and watery diarrhea. During the physical examination, the medical team observes that the patient's stools emit an unusual faint glow. The patient appears disoriented and fatigued. The medical history reveals that the patient attended a local festival the previous day and consumed various food items there. The following exposures might be contributing to which substance toxication? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Phosphorus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Comparison of Poisoning Types:

questions.text: Out of the options given below the most common habit-forming drug is? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Heroin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Common habit-forming drugs:
  • ➤ Cannabis Opioids Amphetamine and prescription stimulants Ecstasy Cocaine
  • ➤ Cannabis
  • ➤ Opioids
  • ➤ Amphetamine and prescription stimulants
  • ➤ Ecstasy
  • ➤ Cocaine
  • ➤ Heroin is the most common drug which is habit forming or in other words can cause physical dependence in which a patient gets withdrawal if he does not take the drug.

questions.text: Identify the plant given in the image below? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Argemone Mexicana

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The plant Argemone mexicana, identifiable by its yellow flowers and spiny leaves, is known for its toxic oil extract which can cause Epidemic dropsy.

questions.text: A patient consumed a toxic substance and presented with tachycardia, visual disturbances, metabolic acidosis, and normal calcium levels. What is the likely diagnosis? (Twisted PYQ)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Methanol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methanol poisoning is characterized by visual disturbances, metabolic acidosis, and normal calcium levels, distinguishing it from ethylene glycol poisoning which causes hypocalcemia.

questions.text: A family died in a closed room which was full of smoke from woodfire. Which of the following is the finding seen on the body? (FMGE JULY 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Cherry red hypostasis due to CO

questions.correct_answer: A. Cherry red hypostasis due to CO
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cherry red hypostasis due to CO

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The characteristic finding in cases of carbon monoxide poisoning is cherry red hypostasis, which helps differentiate it from other causes of death in fire-related incidents.

Ans. B. Capitate

questions.text: A 10-year-old male child came to the casualty with difficulty in walking and pain in the perianal region. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, yellow needle-shaped crystals are seen under the microscope. What is the test done? ( NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Barberio’s Test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen: Florence and Barberio test (Both are presumptive tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen:
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood: Teichmann’s and Takayama test (Both are confirmatory tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood:
  • ➤ Non-cellular Semen Markers: Acid phosphatase test (quantitative), Prostate specific antigen or PSA (p30)
  • ➤ Non-cellular Semen Markers:

questions.text: Identify the type of physical restraint given in the picture below: ( INICET May 2021)

Ans. C. Hog tie

  • ➤ Hog tying involves restraining a person’s hands behind their back, restraining their feet, and coupling the hand and feet restraints together from behind, often used as a form of torture or control.
